result.Title: Key Findings of Socio-Technical Evaluation on Big Data Developmental Processes and User Adoption Factors
result.Introduction: A socio-technical evaluation was conducted to understand the developmental processes of Big Data and the factors influencing user adoption. This evaluation aimed to demystify Big Data ecology, its perception by stakeholders, potential value, challenges, and implications for various organizations and policymakers.
result.Main Body: The socio-technical evaluation on the Big Data phenomenon revealed insights into the developmental processes through which new practices of thinking and enacting are implemented, embedded, and integrated, specifically in South Korea. Regarding user adoption, empirical analyses of user modeling identified cognitive motivations and user values as the primary determining factors influencing users' adoption of Big Data. Based on these findings, the study concluded that Big Data development should be guided by user-centered ideas, emphasizing that users ought to be the central focus of Big Data design.
result.Conclusion: In summary, the socio-technical evaluation highlighted the importance of understanding the integration of new Big Data practices and identified cognitive motivations and user values as crucial for user adoption. The overarching recommendation is to prioritize user-centered design in Big Data development.

The purpose of this study is to determine the key socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. A systematic literature review was conducted using peer-reviewed scholarly publications spanning from 2013 to 2023 to illuminate the influencing factors. Twelve papers focused on the factors influencing big data analytics (BDA) adoption in healthcare services were included for review. The factors were divided into four major groups namely i) person, ii) technology, iii) organization, and iv) environment. Analytical skills define a person, whereas technology is characterized by system quality and information quality. Organization support, organization resources, training, data governance, and evidence-based decision-making are all associated with the organization. Finally, government regulations are allocated to the environment. This review presents evidence of the socio-technical factors that influence big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. The findings from this review recommend future big data analytics adoption in healthcare services to carefully evaluate the factors identified in this study.

queries.query: What are the key findings of the socio-technical evaluation on Big Data developmental processes and the factors influencing user adoption?

hits.title: Demystifying big data: Anatomy of big data developmental process
hits.abstract: This study seeks to understand big data ecology, how it is perceived by different stakeholders, the potential value and challenges, and the implications for the private sector and public organizations, as well as for policy makers. With Normalization Process Theory in place, this study conducts socio-technical evaluation on the big data phenomenon to understand the developmental processes through which new practices of thinking and enacting are implemented, embedded, and integrated in South Korea. It also undertakes empirical analyses of user modeling to explore the factors influencing users' adoption of big data by integrating cognitive motivations as well as user values as the primary determining factors. Based on the qualitative and quantitative findings, this study concludes that big data should be developed with user-centered ideas and that users should be the focus of big data design. (C) 2015 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
hits.author: nan
hits.embedding_text:
Demystifying big data: Anatomy of big data developmental process Demystifying big data: Anatomy of big data developmental process Demystifying big data: Anatomy of big data developmental process

This study seeks to understand big data ecology, how it is perceived by different stakeholders, the potential value and challenges, and the implications for the private sector and public organizations, as well as for policy makers. With Normalization Process Theory in place, this study conducts socio-technical evaluation on the big data phenomenon to understand the developmental processes through which new practices of thinking and enacting are implemented, embedded, and integrated in South Korea. It also undertakes empirical analyses of user modeling to explore the factors influencing users' adoption of big data by integrating cognitive motivations as well as user values as the primary determining factors. Based on the qualitative and quantitative findings, this study concludes that big data should be developed with user-centered ideas and that users should be the focus of big data design. (C) 2015 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

This study seeks to understand big data ecology, how it is perceived by different stakeholders, the potential value and challenges, and the implications for the private sector and public organizations, as well as for policy makers. With Normalization Process Theory in place, this study conducts socio-technical evaluation on the big data phenomenon to understand the developmental processes through which new practices of thinking and enacting are implemented, embedded, and integrated in South Korea. It also undertakes empirical analyses of user modeling to explore the factors influencing users' adoption of big data by integrating cognitive motivations as well as user values as the primary determining factors. Based on the qualitative and quantitative findings, this study concludes that big data should be developed with user-centered ideas and that users should be the focus of big data design. queries.query: What factors influencing user adoption were identified in the socio-technical evaluation?

hits.title: Socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare
hits.abstract: The purpose of this study is to determine the key socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. A systematic literature review was conducted using peer-reviewed scholarly publications spanning from 2013 to 2023 to illuminate the influencing factors. Twelve papers focused on the factors influencing big data analytics (BDA) adoption in healthcare services were included for review. The factors were divided into four major groups namely i) person, ii) technology, iii) organization, and iv) environment. Analytical skills define a person, whereas technology is characterized by system quality and information quality. Organization support, organization resources, training, data governance, and evidence-based decision-making are all associated with the organization. Finally, government regulations are allocated to the environment. This review presents evidence of the socio-technical factors that influence big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. The findings from this review recommend future big data analytics adoption in healthcare services to carefully evaluate the factors identified in this study.
hits.author: nan
hits.embedding_text:
Socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare Socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare Socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare

The purpose of this study is to determine the key socio-technical factors influencing big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. A systematic literature review was conducted using peer-reviewed scholarly publications spanning from 2013 to 2023 to illuminate the influencing factors. Twelve papers focused on the factors influencing big data analytics (BDA) adoption in healthcare services were included for review. The factors were divided into four major groups namely i) person, ii) technology, iii) organization, and iv) environment. Analytical skills define a person, whereas technology is characterized by system quality and information quality. Organization support, organization resources, training, data governance, and evidence-based decision-making are all associated with the organization. Finally, government regulations are allocated to the environment. This review presents evidence of the socio-technical factors that influence big data analytics adoption in healthcare services. The findings from this review recommend future big data analytics adoption in healthcare services to carefully evaluate the factors identified in this study.
